edu.biu.scapi.circuits.circuit
Class Gate

java.lang.Object
  edu.biu.scapi.circuits.circuit.Gate
Direct Known Subclasses:
ANDGate, NOTGate, ORGate, XORGate
public class Gate
extends java.lang.Object

The Gate class is a software representation of a circuit's gate.

It contains a truth table that performs a function on the values of the input Wires and assigns that value to the output Wire(s).

Author:
Steven Goldfeder

Constructor Detail

Gate

public Gate(int gateNumber,
            java.util.BitSet truthTable,
            int[] inputWireIndices,
            int[] outputWireIndices)
Sets the given values.

Parameters:
gateNumber - The gate's number (in a circuit all gates will be numbered).
truthTable - A BitSet representation of the final column of a truth table( i.e. the output of the function being computed).
inputWireIndices - An array containing the indices of the gate's input Wires.
outputWireIndices - An array containing the indices of the gate's input Wire(s). There will generally be a single output Wire. However in instances in which fan-out of the output Wire is >1, we left the option for treating this as multiple Wires.
Method Detail

equals

public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
Overrides:
equals in class java.lang.Object
Parameters:
obj - A gate that is to be tested for equality to the current Gate.
Returns:
true if the gates are equivalent and false otherwise.

getInputWireIndices

public int[] getInputWireIndices()
Returns an array containing the indices of the input Wires to this Gate.

Returns:
an array containing the indices of the input Wires to this Gate.

getOutputWireIndices

public int[] getOutputWireIndices()
Returns the indices of the Wires that are the output of this Gate.

In most circuit designs, this will contain a single wire. However, in the case of fan-out > 1, some circuit designers may treat each as separate wires.

Returns:
an integer array containing the indices of the Wires that are the output to this Gate.

getTruthTable

public java.util.BitSet getTruthTable()
Returns the Gate's truth table.

Returns:
a BitSet representation of the Gate's truth table.

getGateNumber

public int getGateNumber()
Returns the Gate's number.

Returns:
the number of this gate.
